docs.lead_paragraph: The United States has come a long way over the last century. Still, it remains a strikingly similar place in a couple of important respects.
docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column says that while United States has made progress over last century regarding income inequality, it remains strikingly similar place in some important respects; notes that parallel offers valuable insight into how growing concentration of wealth makes inequality harder to correct and produces political polarization and gridlock.
docs.snippet: The United States has come a long way over the last century. Still, it remains a strikingly similar place in a couple of important respects.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal overseer of the mortgage financing giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac has increased their mission at a time when they were supposedly being phased out.

headline.main: A Major Lift for Fannie and Freddie
headline.print_headline: A Major Lift for Fannie and Freddie

docs.abstract: Federal Housing Finance Agency, overseer of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, announces shift in policies intended to maintain mortgage finance giants' role in housing market, spur more home lending and aid distressed homeowners; statement, which comes as mortgage institutions are supposedly being phased out, raises bigger and divisive questions about whether they should be used as instruments for government housing policy.
docs.snippet: The federal overseer of the mortgage financing giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac has increased their mission at a time when they were supposedly being phased out.

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Unassuming, media-shy and, as yet, unproven, Jay Y. Lee is the unofficial heir-apparent to lead Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, as the world's biggest technology group by sales approaches a crossroads after years of explosive growth.

headline.main: Samsung's 'Crown Prince' in Focus as Father Hospitalized
headline.print_headline: Samsung's 'Crown Prince' in Focus as Father Hospitalized

docs.lead_paragraph: In the latest prep work for a presidential campaign, Rand Paul is conspicuously courting moderate and establishment Republicans while Ted Cruz keeps up a travel schedule that has 2016 written all over it. Jeb Bush is stirring from something of a political snooze and a half-dozen other credible prospects are getting their voices heard in the din.

docs.lead_paragraph: Northwestern athletic director Jim Phillips says college athletes need more than just a voice when it comes to issues that affect them. They need a vote.

headline.main: Northwestern AD Says Athletes Need a Vote
headline.print_headline: Northwestern AD Says Athletes Need a Vote

docs.lead_paragraph: Some consumers who bought insurance under President Barack Obama's health care law are experiencing buyer's remorse after realizing that their longtime doctors aren't accepting the new plans.

headline.main: Consumers Losing Doctors With New Insurance Plans
headline.print_headline: Consumers Losing Doctors With New Insurance Plans

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Marco Rubio, a likely Republican candidate for the White House, on Tuesday unveiled plans to give more Americans a way to save for retirement while raising the retirement age for younger workers.

headline.main: Senator Rubio Unveils Proposal to Reform Retirement Policy
headline.print_headline: Senator Rubio Unveils Proposal to Reform Retirement Policy

docs.lead_paragraph: States that thus far have refused a federal offer to expand Medicaid are still seeing significant sign-ups for the safety-net program that serves the poor, according to a report Tuesday that raises political and budget implications.

headline.main: Medicaid Rolls Grow in States Resisting Health Law
headline.print_headline: Medicaid Rolls Grow in States Resisting Health Law

docs.snippet: States that thus far have refused a federal offer to expand Medicaid are still seeing significant sign-ups for the safety-net program that serves the poor, according to a report Tuesday that raises political and budget implications.

docs.lead_paragraph: California's tax windfall lifted Gov. Jerry Brown's spending plan to a record level Tuesday, but the Democratic governor cautioned that the surplus is needed for higher-than-expected health care costs and an underfunded teachers' pension system.
docs.snippet: California's tax windfall lifted Gov. Jerry Brown's spending plan to a record level Tuesday, but the Democratic governor cautioned that the surplus is needed for higher-than-expected health care costs and an underfunded teachers' pension system.
